snippet: Michel Martelly runs Haiti without a Parliament and has been accused of protecting a network of friends who have been arrested on charges like murder and drug trafficking.
abstract: Haiti's Parliament remains empty after Pres Michel Martelly and opposition could not agree on elections, allowing Martelly to govern country for two months by executive order without checks and balances; Martelly's administration has come under increasing criticism as scandals involving those close to him have continued to be revealed, raising questions about his ability to lead.
lead_paragraph: Michel Martelly runs Haiti without a Parliament and has been accused of protecting a network of friends who have been arrested on charges like murder and drug trafficking.

headline.main: Haitian Leader’s Power Grows as Scandals Swirl
headline.print_headline: Haitian Leader’s Power Grows as Scandals Swirl
